item.title: Standard Error v. Standard Deviation
item.description: What’s the difference between standard error and standard deviation? Every new data scientist asks this question of themselves. Honestly, the difference is nuanced, and standard error is a form of standard deviation. Standard Deviation is a measure of the variability within a sample - this can be a sample of a population or the entire population itself. A lower standard deviation indicates that values in a distribution tend closer toward the mean of that distribution, while high standard deviation suggests that values are dispersed more greatly from the mean.
